metadata.title: CVE-2016-9905 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A potentially exploitable crash in "EnumerateSubDocuments" while adding orremoving sub-documents. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 45.6 andThunderbird < 45.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
